title: The ketogenic diet is not for everyone: contraindications, side effects, and drug interactions.
abstract: The ketogenic diet (KD), initially developed for the treatment of neurological disorders, has gained increasing attention for its potential role in the management of various metabolic diseases. Alongside its expanding clinical use, concerns have emerged regarding its safety, tolerability, and suitability in specific patient populations. This review summarises key contraindications, clinical situations requiring caution, relevant drug interactions, and commonly reported adverse effects associated with KD.
